content: विधेय {%<ab>pot. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} To be done or performed. {@--2@} To be enjoyed or prescribed. {@--3@} ({%a%}) Dependent on. at the disposal of; अथ विधिविधेयः परिचयः <ls>Māl. 2. 13.</ls> ({%b%}) Subject to, influenced or controlled by, subdued or overpowered by (usually in <ab>comp.</ab>); तिद्राविधेयं नरदेवसैन्यं <ls>R. 7. 62</ls>; संभाव्यमानस्नेहरसेनाभिसंधिना विधेयीकृतोऽपि <ls>Māl. 1.</ls> <ls>Bg. 2. 64</ls>; भ्रातुः सौहार्देन विधेयीकृतोस्मि <ls>Mv. 7</ls>; <ls>Mu. 3. 1</ls>; <ls>Śi. 3. 20</ls>; <ls>R. 19. 4.</ls> {@--4@} Obedient, tractable, compliant, submissive; अविधेयेंद्रियः पुंसां गौरिवैति विधेयतां <ls>Ki. 11. 33.</ls> {@--5@} To be predicated (in gram &c.); अत्र मिथ्यामहिमत्वं नानुवाद्यं अपि तु विधेयं <ls>K. P. 7.</ls> --यं {@--1@} What ought to be done, a duty; <ls>Ki. 1. 25</ls>, <ls n="Ki.">16. 62.</ls> {@--2@} The predicate of a proposition. --यः A servant, dependant.
